result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic J Manriquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha. Sign releases for agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No Contact with the victim or her residence. If any contact is needed, must be through agent Only. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 11/11/2015 by 8pm. LAST 45 Days are STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Request to impose 45 days condition time, filed by Probation Agent Martins.   Signed by Judge Carter on 06/26/17.
(Fax) Dated 10/29/15, from Atty Powers to Judge Carter, requesting to move up the start date of Defendant's huber sentence.

Defendant Dominic J Manriquez in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Counts #2, 3 and 4.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #2, 3 and 4.   Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Powers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim or her residence  (contact, if any needed, must be through agent only)
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management and sign releases

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  55 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 11/11/15 by 8:00 p.m. - LAST 45 DAYS STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #3:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim or her residence  (contact, if any needed, must be through agent only)
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management and sign releases

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #4:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim or her residence  (contact, if any needed, must be through agent only)
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha/Anger Management and sign releases

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


***Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.***

Defendant Dominic J Manriquez in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Powers requests one more adjournment for plea and sentence.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
